metadata.title: CVE-2023-52525 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: wifi:mwifiex: Fix oob check condition in mwifiex_process_rx_packet Only skip thecode path trying to access the rfc1042 headers when the buffer is toosmall, so the driver can still process packets without rfc1042 headers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52525` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
